meanings.definition: Assume a particular attitude or pose for effect.
meanings.sent1: She likes to attitudinize in front of the mirror.
meanings.sent2: The actor tends to attitudinize on stage to impress the audience.
meanings.sent3: During the play, the character would attitudinize comically to make the audience laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her attitudinizing at work was like a mask hiding her true feelings.
meanings.sent5: The politician's attitudinizing made him seem insincere to the voters.

meanings.definition: Behave in an affected or theatrical manner.
meanings.sent1: He would attitudinize whenever he wanted attention.
meanings.sent2: The child would attitudinize when trying to get out of trouble.
meanings.sent3: At the party, she would attitudinize by pretending to be a famous celebrity.
meanings.sent4: His attitudinizing at work was like watching a bad actor in a play.
meanings.sent5: The cat attitudinized by arching its back and hissing at the dog.
